chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel C Buck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

miscConds.notes:
-To pay costs of $268
-To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
-To pay $90 subpoena fees
-To pay restitution in an amount not to exceed $10,000 for future counseling or psychotherapy for victim, under 973.20(4m)

-Continue Psychosexual treatment and counseling, until successfully discharged
-Continue AODA Counseling as recommended by treatment provider
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
-No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
-To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
-Random drug screens
-To submit DNA Sample upon demand
-No unsupervised contact with minor children
-Contact may be allowed with biological children if approved by Agent and treatment providers
-May have contact with wife upon her approval
-Sex offender registration & reporting under 301.45

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
-To serve 1 year, in the Jefferson County Jail, with NO Huber/work-release privileges for the 1st six months of sentence, except for treatment purposes and with Huber privileges for the last six months of sentence for the purposes of treatment and employment, to commence forthwith

-Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/Work-Release privileges without further process.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences the Defendant to  14  years Imprisonment, consisting of 8 years Initial Confinement and 6 years Extended Supervision.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being.

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  1949   days credit for time already served.

superMiscConds.notes:
The Court orders conditions of  Extended Supervision to be the same as previously ordered as conditions of Probation 

The Court orders Mr. Buck to comply with Sex Offender Registry requirements.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom conference] 
cases #14CF40 and #18CF425 called at 2:28pm 
Defendant Daniel C Buck appears from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. Attorney Jason Luczak appears. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court verifies with Mr. Buck that he can see and hear the proceedings through the Zoom video-connection. 

These cases are scheduled for Sentencing After Revocation and Plea/Sentencing hearing respectively today, however ADA Teuber has submitted a written request to adjourn. 
The Court and counsel discuss the recent filing of the lengthy defense memorandum and attachments [in Case #14CF40], which includes an indication that there is no longer a plea agreement in Case #18CF425.
After discussion with counsel, the Court grants the State's request for a sixty day adjournment. 

--As to the Case #14CF40 : the State will file its sentencing recommendation, since the CCS that had included the recommendation is no longer being submitted by the Defense. The Court indicates that a side-by-side comparison of what the parties are recommending is to be provided. Attorney Luczak may provide a reply to the State's submission either in written form or through oral argument during the sentencing.  
--As to Case #18CF425: the scheduling of jury trial will be accomplished after the Court rules on the pending Motion to Suppress. 
recess 2:45pm 

NEXT:  (1) Evidentiary Hearing in Case #18CF425 (re the Defendant's Motion to Suppress which has already been briefed) on a date to be set by the JA (allow 3-4 hours);  (2) Sentencing After Revocation in Case #14CF40 on June 24th at 2:30pm with in-person appearances (allow remainder of afternoon)

Counsel indicate that the parties have come to a global resolution. The State's is requesting that the cases be scheduled soon; a goal of the resolution is that the incarceration is served in the prison system, rather than Mr. Buck getting the credit for days served in the Jail. 
Attorney Luczak indicates that he intends to file a sentencing memorandum.  ADA Tueber indicates that the joint agreement on both cases is set forth on a Criminal Case Settlement form that can be submitted. 
Attorney Luczak requests that the next hearing be scheduled with in-person appearances.

Case called at 2:36 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Daniel C Buck in court with Attorney Nicholas Frederick Gansner and Attorney Lester Pines. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court/Counsel discuss submission of defense 3/27/15 - Clerk confirms that submission has not been received by COC - Atty Gansner provides the Court with copies
off-record: 2:42 - 2:44 pm for Court to review materials
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Sentencing arguments by Counsel

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 10 years, with conditions:
-To serve 1 year, in the Jefferson County Jail, with NO Huber/work-release privileges for the 1st six months of sentence, except for treatment purposes and with Huber privileges for the last six months of sentence for the purposes of treatment and employment, to commence forthwith
-Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/Work-Release privileges without further process.
-Continue Psychosexual treatment and counseling, until successfully discharged
-Continue AODA Counseling as recommended by treatment provider
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
-No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
-To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
-Random drug screens
-To pay costs of $268
-To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
-To submit DNA Sample upon demand
-To pay $90 subpoena fees
-To pay restitution in an amount not to exceed $10,000 for future counseling or psychotherapy for victim, under 973.20(4m)
-No unsupervised contact with minor children
-Contact may be allowed with biological children if approved by Agent and treatment providers
-May have contact with wife upon her approval
-Sex offender registration & reporting under 301.45

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Days credit given for time already served: 0 days 
Atty Pines orally motions to seal treatment evaluations & letters received from Colorado, Utah & Madison
No objection from the State; Court orders all documents re: treatment shall be sealed

Case called at 9:31am[MO & MK]
Defendant Daniel C Buck in court with Attorney Nicholas F. Gansner and Lester A. Pines.   ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Buck, verifying that he understands and joins in the plea agreement.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Mr. Buck guilty of Count #2, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State the Court Reads- in and dismisses Count #1

Atty. Ganser requests that sentencing be scheduled to a later date.
Atty. Pines indicates that the Defense intends to file a sentencing memorandum.
ADA Hall motions to revoke bond. ADA Hall reports that the State has learned violations of the bond contact prohibitations.
Arguments on the Motion given by ADA Hall, Atty. Ganser, Atty. Pines.
The Court denies the motion to revoke bond.

Case called at 1:16 pm
Defendant Daniel C Buck in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Nicholas Gansner. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Counts #1 & #2.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with PSB (DOB: 8/3/03) or LLB (DOB: 3/4/69)
-No contact with his children 
-No unsupervised contact with minors except incidental contact
-Maintain Absolute Sobriety
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:31 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
